# NSFileHandleReadToEndOfFileCompletion

**Type Property**

Posted when the file handle reads all data in the file or, in a communications channel, until the other process signals the end of data.

## Declaration

```swift
static let NSFileHandleReadToEndOfFileCompletion: NSNotification.Name
```

## Discussion

It makes the data available to observers by putting it in the `userInfo` dictionary. To cause the posting of this notification, you must send either [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileHandle/readToEndOfFileInBackgroundAndNotify()] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FileHandle/readToEndOfFileInBackgroundAndNotify(forModes:)] to an appropriate `NSFileHandle` object.

The notification object is the `NSFileHandle` object that sent the notification. The `userInfo` dictionary contains the following information:



## Notifications

- **NSFileHandleConnectionAccepted**: Posted when a file handle object establishes a socket connection between two processes, creates a file handle object for one end of the connection, and makes this object available to observers.
- **NSFileHandleDataAvailable**: Posted when the file handle determines that data is currently available for reading in a file or at a communications channel.
- **readCompletionNotification**: Posted when the file handle reads the data currently available in a file or at a communications channel.
